alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Dickson; Hickman; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 3:26PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT DICKSON...NORTHWESTERN WILLIAMSON...SOUTHERN CHEATHAM AND NORTHEASTERN HICKMAN COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM CDT... At 325 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from McEwen to near White Bluff. Movement was south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Dickson, White Bluff, Kingston Springs, Burns, Fairview, Charlotte, Vanleer, Bon Aqua, and Lyles. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 161 and 187. Interstate 840 between mile markers 1 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
